articles.title: Mayline
articles.description: Each ear in cats has 32 muscles. Approximately 70% of a cat's life is spent sleeping, which can be up to 16 hours every day.

articles.title: Darla
articles.description: Cats ought to have 18 toes (five toes on each front paw; four toes on each back paw).

articles.title: Macy
articles.description: Cats' claws all point downward, therefore, they are unable to descend trees headfirst. Instead, they must regress the trunk.

articles.title: Winnie
articles.description: Cats may groom themselves for up to a third of their awake hours. Humans only have 206 bones, compared to 230 in cats.

articles.title: Snow
articles.description: Cats have a six-times-their-length leap capacity.  Dogs only have a few vocalizations, compared to cats' over a hundred.

articles.title: Aria
articles.description: Since cats make this sound when they're joyful as well as when they're sick or upset, purring may be a form of self-soothing activity.
